Key Match Events: Kwadwo Duah scored in his first international match.
Michel Aebischer scored a superb curling shot from outside the box.
Barnab√°s Varga equalized for Hungary in the 66th minute.
Breel Embolo sealed the win in stoppage time.
Pre-Game Insights: Switzerland made a flying start to their Euro 2024 campaign with a commanding 3-1 win over Hungary.
Switzerland were composed, organized, and quick on the attack, while Hungary made numerous errors and struggled to get into the game.
Hungary's start to their third successive European Championship was disappointing, with expectations high after a run of 14 games unbeaten.
Post-Match Reflections: Swiss coach Murat Yakin said, 'We focused on making the most of our strength and we made our opponents' lives very hard.'
Hungary coach Marco Rossi lamented, 'The first half was very bad... we were too passive.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: It was Ale Moreno's reaction to Switzerland's impressive win over Hungary.
Granit Xhaka performed a vital role in the victory, controlling the pace of play, delivering pinpoint passes and twice coming close to scoring late goals.
Aebischer and Duah were brought back into the Switzerland side and Embolo was fit again after injury.
